Document Title: Big data Analysis on The Management Content of College Students' Mental Health Education
Publication Title: 2021 13th International Conference on Measuring Technology and Mechatronics Automation (ICMTMA)
Abstract: To solve the problems of big data demand and data awareness low, data storage demand and storage technology backward in health education in Colleges and universities, this paper integrates modern information technology into the field of mental health education of college students. Based on the detailed analysis and comparison of various classification algorithms, combined with the characteristics of psychological problem data, C4.5 decision tree algorithm is selected to construct a decision tree model for the psychological problem of symptoms, and uses it to predict the psychological problems of college students. Then the structure model of negative psychology is established by decision tree, and the potential groups with anxiety and depression are found by using clustering technology. The cause analysis based on actual data can provide reliable basis for psychological educators, to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of school psychological consultation.
Author Keywords: college student;big data;mental health;decision tree;data minting
IEEE Terms: Cloud computing;Statistical analysis;Education;Mental health;Big Data;Predictive models;Classification algorithms
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: big data analysis;management content;college students;big data demand;data awareness;data storage demand;storage technology;universities;modern information technology;mental health education;classification algorithms;psychological problem data;C4.5 decision tree algorithm;decision tree model;psychological problems;negative psychology;clustering technology;cause analysis;psychological educators;school psychological consultation

Document Title: The relationship of social support system and psychological health level for teenagers
Author Affiliations: School of the Physical Education, Hunan University of Technology, Zhuzhou, 421007, China; School of the Physical Education, Hunan University of Technology, Zhuzhou, 421007, China
Publication Title: Proceedings 2011 International Conference on Human Health and Biomedical Engineering
Abstract: In order to explore the relationship between social supporting system and psychological health of teenagers, we investigated the social supporting system and psychological health in Zhuzhou area.350 teenagers in this area were chosen as the subjects. Chinese Middle School Students Psychological Health Scale and Middle School Students' Social Support System Evaluating Scale was employed in our test. Results revealed that teenagers' social supporting system of Zhuzhou was mainly composed of informal and formal system, and informal system played the main role. Teenagers' psychological health problem in this area focused on high pressure of study, emotional instability, relationships crises and anxiety. Differences in the psychological health of the high and low level social supporting system group were statistically significant, except for the difference in obsession. There is significant negative correlation between the social supporting system and each factors of psychological health.
Author Keywords: teenagers;the social supporting system;psychological health level
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: social support system;psychological health level;teenagers;Zhuzhou;Chinese middle school student;informal system;psychological health problem;educational pressure;emotional instability;relationship crisis;anxiety

Document Title: Study on effects of different methods of health education on tuberculosis among the primary and middle school students in rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province
Authors: Pingmin Wei; Xiaona Cong; Wanqin Tang; Shang Cao; Peng-fei Luo; Wei Li; Danyi Luo
Author Affiliations: Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; Southeast university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China
Publication Title: 2011 International Conference on Remote Sensing, Environment and Transportation Engineering
Abstract: Objective To study the core message awareness of tuberculosis(TB) prevention and treatment among the primary and middle school students in rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province and to relevant influencing factors. To evaluate the intervention effects of different methods of health education on Tuberculosis, and provide a health education method which take the best effect. Methods Ten primary and middle schools were selected by stratified random sampling in rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province. There were 6 000 students to finish the questionnaires including the general information, knowledge, attitude, practice of TB prevention and treatment. 100 students per school and three primary and three middle schools were selected by multistage cluster sampling in three rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province. The interviews were divided into two intervention groups (comprehensive intervention and General intervention) and one control group. Results The general awareness rates of core messages on TB were 35.4%. The results of the multiple linear regression analysis showed that sex, age, father education, family type, and family income were significantly associated with increased knowledge scores. The awareness rates of the TB core information of comprehensive intervention group, the general intervention group and the control group were 90.5%, 81.5% and 60.4% after intervention. Conclusion Knowledge on tuberculosis prevention and control should be improved among the primary and middle school students in rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province. Compared with the general intervention group, comprehensive intervention education on TB was suitable for the primary school students in rural areas of northern Jiangsu Province.
Author Keywords: Tuberculosis;primary and middle school students;Health education;Intervention effects
INSPEC Controlled Terms: biomedical education;diseases;medical computing;patient treatment;regression analysis;sampling methods
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: health education;tuberculosis;primary school students;school students;rural areas;northern Jiangsu Province;core message awareness;tuberculosis prevention;tuberculosis treatment;intervention effects;stratified random sampling;multistage cluster sampling;multiple linear regression analysis;sex;age;father education;family type;family income

Document Title: Experimental research into the influence on middle school students' mental health during health promotion
Author Affiliations: Physical Culture Institute of Changchun Normal University, Changchun, Jilin Province 130032; Physical Culture Institute of Changchun Normal University, Changchun, Jilin Province 130032
Publication Title: Proceedings 2011 International Conference on Human Health and Biomedical Engineering
Abstract: It is pointed by the mental hygiene office of WHO: schools are the optimum places for promoting students' mental health as they may impart some skills for solving problems to students and change students' behaviors by intervening in special problems and giving psychological consultation. The Physical Education and Health has become one part of school education, which is the main way for promoting students' health and is naturally tasked to help students to improve their endurance and anti-frustration ability. The research is based on the experiments to promote middle school students' mental health, aiming at establishing a model for promoting middle school students' mental health through the experimental research into the promotion of middle school students' mental health, providing theoretical support for training new qualified talents as required for the society and making contributions to social harmony.
Author Keywords: Health Promotion;Middle School Students;Mental Health;Experimental Research;Intervention
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: middle school students;mental health;health promotion;WHO mental hygiene office;problem solving;psychological consultation;physical education;social harmony

Document Title: Tests and Analysis of Health States for Graduate Students Based on the Random Matrix Theory
Authors: J. -S. Yu; M. Lu; X. -Q. Wang; J. -R. Peng
Author Affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications,Beijing,China; School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications,Beijing,China; School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications,Beijing,China; School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications,Beijing,China
Publication Title: 2020 Cross Strait Radio Science & Wireless Technology Conference (CSRSWTC)
Abstract: In this paper, the health status is studied for 26 volunteers of graduate students by calculating the average spectral radius of the finger pulse under the random matrix theory. It has been found that the average spectral radius of the pulse is higher for health status than that for unhealth status. This results are compared with the phase diagram of health which is filled in by volunteers actively.
Author Keywords: pulse;random matrix;mean spectral radius;phase diagram of health

Document Title: Effect of the information intervention on improving physical health of obese college students
Author Affiliations: Xidian University,School of P.E.,Xi’an,China,710071; Xidian University,School of P.E.,Xi’an,China,710071
Publication Title: 2020 International Conference on Computers, Information Processing and Advanced Education (CIPAE)
Abstract: An intervention experiment was conducted on an obese student through information intervention. Based on the theory of cognition and motivation, this paper discusses the application of information intervention in obese college students through the case study. According to the research, after the intervention of information for four months, it can improve college students' recognition and attention to beauty of body shape. And it can stimulate their motivation to seek solutions actively and maintain their motivation level continuously. It can also promote college students to participate in scientific sports and exercise, in order to improve their health metrics. Finally, the students' body shape has been improved significantly.
Author Keywords: Information intervention;Obesity of college students;Level of Health;Case study
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: obese student;intervention experiment;obese college students;information intervention

Document Title: An Approach for Mental Preparation for First-Year College Students: A Case Study of Engineering Students
Authors: P. Aree; C. Surawattanaboon; P. Kaewprapha; K. Silawarawet
Author Affiliations: Thammasat University,Department of Electrical and Computer Engieerning,Pathumthani,Thailand; Thammasat University,Department of Electrical and Computer Engieerning,Pathumthani,Thailand; Thammasat University,Department of Electrical and Computer Engieerning,Pathumthani,Thailand; Thammasat University,Department of Electrical and Computer Engieerning,Pathumthani,Thailand
Abstract: As first-year university students prepare to head to classes, many of them are worrying about how they will handle new responsibilities and workloads. Often, they fail to prioritize their learning needs due to anxiety. Hence, this paper presents a case study to illustrate a mindfulness meditative approach for helping electrical and computer engineering students to alleviate their anxiety during transition from high school to college. A sample of 44 first-year students at Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Thammasat University, voluntarily completed questionnaire after participating mindfulness training exercise. The survey results indicate their good satisfactions.
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: mental preparation;first-year college students;engineering students;first-year university students;mindfulness meditative approach;Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering;high school;Thammasat University;mindfulness training exercise

Document Title: Study of health education for university students in the new period
Author Affiliations: Division of Physical Education, Zhejiang University of Science and Technology, Hangzhou, China
Publication Title: Proceedings 2011 International Conference on Human Health and Biomedical Engineering
Abstract: Health education is an important part of school education. In this paper, we investigate the health problems of university students, the status of health education, students' knowledge of health and their attitudes. The problems existing in health education and their causes are analyzed, and the corresponding countermeasures and suggestions have been proposed to improve the health status of students.

Document Title: Cross-Sectional Survey on Sub-Health Status of College Students in a Medical School of Shaanxi Province in 2016
Authors: J. Tan; J. Lei; M. Shi; K. Men; R. Zhang; Y. Ma
Author Affiliations: Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Xi'an Med. Univ., Xi'an, China; Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Xi'an Med. Univ., Xi'an, China; Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Xi'an Med. Univ., Xi'an, China; Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Xi'an Med. Univ., Xi'an, China; Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Shaanxi Univ. of Chinese Med., Xianyang, China; Dept. of Epidemiology & Health Stat., Xi'an Med. Univ., Xi'an, China
Publication Title: 2018 9th International Conference on Information Technology in Medicine and Education (ITME)
Abstract: Objective To investigate the sub-health status and its influencing factors of medical college students in Shaanxi province, and to provide the basis for the formulation of intervention measures. Method We selected total of 776 undergraduates in a medical college in Shaanxi province as the research objects. We used “the China's urban residents sub-health status self-rating scale" to collect information and analyzed the factors which affecting Sub-health of College Students by Multi - factor Logistics Regression. Results It can be seen from this study that the detection rate of sub-health of medical college students is 31.19%, and the fourth grade detection rate of sub-health is higher than that of other grades (F=11.476, P= 0.000), the detection rate of students who's living expenses under 800 yuan increased significantly than other students. (F=8.732, P=0.000). After using the multivariate logistic regression analysis methods, we found that diet situation (OR = 0.732), physical exercise (OR = 0.617), stay up all night (OR = 1.378), employment pressure (OR = 2.453), cell phone usage (OR = 1.907), emotional condition (OR = 1.530), and psychological condition (OR = 1.601) are all the factors of sub-health. The protective factor of sub - health status of college students are eating on time, regular physical exercise. While often stay up all night, the employment pressure, longtime use of mobile phone, anxiety and unhealthy psychological feelings are the risk factors of sub - health status. Conclusion The sub-health detection rate of medical college students is lower than non-medical college students. So maintain the regular, good habits and living conditions, adhere to physical exercise, rational and scientific use of mobile phones, ease their employment pressure and negative emotions, are the effective measures for improving the health status of college students.
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: medical college students;Shaanxi province;fourth grade detection rate;multivariate logistic regression analysis methods;employment pressure;sub-health detection rate;nonmedical college students;medical school;China;undergraduates;urban residents sub-health status self-rating scale;diet situation;physical exercise;cell phone usage;emotional condition;psychological condition

Document Title: Study on the influencing factors of health knowledge and health habits among senior high school students in the deaf-mute high school
Authors: Danyi Luo; Shang Cao; Xiaona Cong; Wanqin Tang; Peng-fei Luo; Wei Li; Pingmin Wei
Author Affiliations: South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China; South east university, School of public health, Nanjing 210009, China
Publication Title: 2011 International Conference on Remote Sensing, Environment and Transportation Engineering
Abstract: [Objective] To understand the deaf-mute high school students' health knowledge and health habits, investigate the influencing factors of health knowledge and health habits for formulating intervention measures. [Methods] A self-designed questionnaire was independently filled by 250 senior high school students at a deaf-mute school. [Results] The awareness rate of health knowledge was 62.9% while the behavior forming rate was 52.8%. The influencing factors of health knowledge were cognitive of the social environment, the school environment, the way of knowledge accepted, and age. The influencing factors of health habits were level of father's educational, grade. [Conclusion] The awareness rate of health knowledge and the formation rate of health habits of the deaf-mute high school students were all at a low level. We should strengthen home-school co-education and concern the health problems of deaf-mute students further.
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: health knowledge;health habits;senior high school students;deaf-mute high school;behavior forming rate;social environment;school environment;knowledge acceptance;age;father educational level;home-school coeducation
